title: Meet the retired oil exec plugging forgotten wells to reduce emissions

multiple-choice.question: What is an orphan well, and why is it an environmental concern?

options.label: A
options.text: An orphan well is an abandoned oil well that has been properly sealed and poses no environmental risk.

options.label: B
options.text: An orphan well is an abandoned oil well that has not been properly sealed and leaks environmental toxins.

options.label: C
options.text: An orphan well is a new oil well that is being drilled and has not yet been sealed.

options.label: D
options.text: An orphan well is a well that has been plugged but still leaks methane.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, approximately how many orphan oil and gas wells are there in the United States?

options.label: C
options.text: 1 million

options.label: D
options.text: 2 million

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated cost of plugging an orphan well?

options.label: B
options.text: $30,000 to $1 million

options.label: C
options.text: $50,000 to $5 million

options.label: D
options.text: $100,000 to $10 million

options.label: B
options.text: Lack of technology

options.label: C
options.text: Lack of funding

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: The well will eventually seal itself.

options.label: B
options.text: The well will produce more oil.

options.label: C
options.text: The well will leak methane and other environmental toxins.

options.label: D
options.text: The well will become a source of clean water.

options.label: A
options.text: The wells are too deep to be sealed.

options.label: B
options.text: The wells are too shallow to be sealed.

options.label: C
options.text: Earthquakes can reopen plugged wells.

options.label: D
options.text: The wells are not accessible.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is one potential solution to the problem of orphan wells?

options.label: A
options.text: To rely solely on government funding to plug wells.

options.label: B
options.text: To abandon all oil and gas wells immediately.

options.label: C
options.text: To drill new wells to replace the orphan wells.

options.label: D
options.text: To get the oil and gas industry to front more of the bill for plugging wells.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it important to address the problem of orphan wells, according to Curtis Shuck?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is a minor environmental issue.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is an economic issue that affects the oil and gas industry.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it is a social issue that affects local communities.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is a major environmental issue that requires immediate attention.
